title: What are some challenges you think the next generation will face in the US? - Quora
tags: Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Mass migrations (away from war, floods, and famines). Biological extinctions and their effects on food and general crop production. Disrupted communications. Authoritarian politics in an effort to regain control of uncontrollable events and consequences. Epidemics of tropical diseases spreading to the northern hemisphere as the climate warms. Wars for productive land and potable water that hasn’t been poisoned. Reforestation efforts, attempts to both protect themselves from rising seas, and enhance the health of the seas and the creatures in them. Revolutions against the greedy rich, usually bringing a new set of thugs to the top to replace the old. Hard, hard times. We’ve brought them on our own children by our stubbornness and foolishness and unwillingness to attack the root causes of these problems. I’m glad I’m old, and sorry that — since I think reincarnation is a real thing — I’m going to have to come back and help deal with the mess we’ve made. On the other hand, this is only just.

There are two main things that I think are going to impact the next generation. #1 is the increasing acceptance of socialism. the lack of education in this area is causing people to think that not only is it acceptable, but that it is desirable. If we walk down the path of socialism our society as we know it will end. #2 is the lack of assimilation. People come from all over to become Americans. Some people embrace the idea of become an American, and an increasing number of people want to hang onto “home” and NOT become part of the general American culture.
